page.title: 04Cairn Circle Heltor D'moor
page.content: An ancient{Stone Cairn}and{Stone {Circle}are situated on a high part of the moorland in grid square 02760087. Access to this feature is an easy walk up from the road to the site on { {Mardon Down. }The stones and boulders that form the circle and cairn are easily distinguished amongst the heather and gorse of the moor. Probably an old Stone Age burial chamber and ceremonial site, this area was most likely chosen because it is one of the highest parts of the moor in this area, being about 356 meters above sea level.
